Title: Object: In Aegyptum Transmigratio
Series: Vita S. Ioseph B.mae Virginis Sponsi Patriarcharum Maximi
Description: The flight into Egypt [Matthew 2:13-23]; St Joseph leads his family across a river on foot; the Virgin and child are seated on a donkey; mountainous background with cityscape, palm and oak trees beyond Engraving and etching
Curator's comments: This is one from a series of twenty-eight unnumbered scenes relating to the life of St Joseph, for comment see 1972,U.6.1. For another impression see also 1896,0203.3.15.
Bibliographic references: Hollstein / Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts c.1450-1700 (undescribed)
Associated names: Associated with: Hendrik van der Gracht (author of Latin verses)
Acquisition notes: Stamped in black ink, in octagon: 'MVSEVM / BRITAN / NICVM' (L.296). Transferred from the British Library; inscribed in graphite on a flyleaf: "c-72 / 7".
